reviews.review_msg: He is a good teacher. His lectures are very clear and exams are fair. The textbook is simple and helpful. One of the hints to prepare for exams is to read each week assigned article and make a summary right away, it will be much easier than doing all of them before exams. He doesn't impose his opinion. He encourages you to think by yourself.

He's one of the most passionate professors I've ever met in my 3 years at SFU so far. His passion for understanding and solving poverty is contagious. Not afraid to say what most of us are thinking, lively and hilarious, invited guest speakers to bring the material to life. LOVE IT! Be warned, there's lots of reading, it's tough work but FUN WORK!
